intro: Phaleria longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed phaleria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish, while its leaves are elliptical and have a pleasant, spicy scent. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
